candidates.definition: Containers designed to hold, protect, and transport items from one location to another.

positive_examples: She packed her clothes into the suitcase for the trip.
The shipping container was loaded onto the cargo ship.
I sealed the envelope and dropped it in the mailbox.
The package arrived damaged during shipping.
Workers unloaded boxes from the freight container.
Mail carriers collect letters from residential mailboxes daily.
negative_examples: She stored leftovers in a plastic food container.
The water bottle kept his drink cold all day.
He planted flowers in a ceramic pot.
The trash can was overflowing with garbage.
She organized her jewelry in a small wooden box.
The storage bin held winter clothes in the attic.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: StorageContainer, FoodContainer, LiquidContainer, WasteContainer

candidates.definition: Vessels designed to hold, store, or prepare food and beverages

positive_examples: She poured the soup into a large pot to heat it up
The wine was stored in cases in the cellar
He opened a can of soda with his lunch
The sauce pan contained the simmering marinara
Beer cans were stacked in the refrigerator
The chef used a double boiler to melt the chocolate
negative_examples: She stored documents in a filing cabinet
The shipping container held electronics from overseas
He packed his clothes in a suitcase for the trip
The toolbox contained screwdrivers and hammers
Books were arranged in the bookcase
The jewelry box held her grandmother's rings
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: StorageContainer, ShippingContainer, Toolbox, Luggage

candidates.definition: A receptacle designed to hold, organize, or temporarily contain objects or materials.

positive_examples: She packed her lunch in a small plastic container.
The storage compartment under the seat held emergency supplies.
He threw the crumpled paper into the wastebasket by his desk.
The mesh bag allowed air to circulate through the produce.
Books were organized in labeled boxes in the attic.
The toolbox compartment kept screws separate from nails.
negative_examples: The water pipe carried fresh water to the house.
She drank coffee from her favorite ceramic mug.
The freight train transported goods across the country.
He cooked pasta in a large stainless steel pot.
The bottle of wine was opened for dinner.
She served soup in elegant porcelain bowls.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DrinkingVessel, CookingContainer, TransportContainer, DisplayCase

candidates.definition: Containers designed for specific protective, storage, or functional purposes beyond general containment

positive_examples: The soldier drew his pistol from its leather holster
The funeral director closed the mahogany coffin gently
Artillery shells exploded overhead during the bombardment
The surgeon carefully examined the inflamed pericardium around the heart
She kept her revolver secure in a shoulder holster
The cemetery workers lowered the wooden casket into the ground
negative_examples: She put groceries in a plastic shopping bag
The books were stored in cardboard boxes
He drank water from a metal bottle
The jewelry was kept in a wooden chest
Food was served in ceramic bowls
The tools were organized in a metal toolbox
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: StorageContainer, TransportContainer, ServingContainer, GeneralContainer
